result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A Hartson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 13 days were granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Case 15CM881 was dismissed and read in. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation on Count 2.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff's Dept. Cash bail applied, paid in full.
With Huber. Sentence credit of 103 days were granted. TIME SERVED
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Perform Alcohol Assessment.
ATTEND the Victim Impact Panel meeting on 01/20/2016 or serve penalty of 30 days Huber, consecutive for non-attendance.

records.addlTxt: fax from the jail regarding jail credit  **no paper copy in physical file**
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christopher A Hartson in court, in custody, with Attorney Donna Kuchler for Attorney Anthony D Cotton.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #2 & 3.  Court performs plea colloquy with Defendant and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #2 & 3.  Repeater enhancer is stricken on Count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kuchler makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR    (13 days credit, if revoked)

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with:______________________________________________________

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted)


COUNT #3:  HUBER:  120 days  (103 days credit) - TIME SERVED -  

FINE: $1,494.00  -  (to be paid out of cash bail posted on this case and Case #15CM881 - remainder due as a condition of probation - probation given on Count #2)

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department. 

DL REVOCATION: 30 months

IGNITION INTERLOCK:  30 months

Victim Impact Panel on:  1/20/16. Defendant to serve 30 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH

***Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.***
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Defendant to post an additional $500.00 - ($700.00 already posted). Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  Defendant to comply with WCS assessment or any recommendation that they make. Defendant to sign release to authorize such monitoring.
